Linear Mixed Model Diagnostics

Source: R/fit_mmrm.R
get_lme4_diagnostics.Rd

Compute the model diagnostic statistics for a linear mixed model fit.

get_lme4_diagnostics(fit, cov_est = get_lme4_cov_estimate(fit))

Arguments

fit

(lmerModLmerTest)
object fit with REML using lmerTest::lmer().

cov_est

(Matrix)
covariance estimate coming from get_lme4_cov_estimate().

Value

a list with the REML criterion, the AIC, AICc and BIC.

Details

AICc is here defined as $$-2 * loglik + 2 * df * (m / (m - df - 1))$$ where loglik is the restricted log likelihood value, df is the number of covariance parameters and m is the number of observations minus the number of fixed effects, or df + 2 if it is smaller than that. The same df is used for AIC and BIC. Note that for BIC, the n used is the number of subjects (instead of the number of observations as in AIC and AICc). This matches the definitions in SAS.
